articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated in Different Countries
Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy in Guinea
articles.content:
Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy in Guinea 
    Pyongyang, February 19 (KCNA) -- Guinean President Lansana Conte sent a basket of flowers to the DPRK embassy in Conakry on Feb. 15 in congratulation of leader Kim Jong Il's birthday.
 The floral basket was laid before the full-length portrait of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.    
 Written on the ribbon of the basket were letters reading "I pay my respects to His Excellency Kim Jong Il. Guinean President General Lansana Conte".

articles.title: Large Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy from Norodom Sihanouk
articles.content:
Large Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy from Norodom Sihanouk 
    Pyongyang, February 19 (KCNA) -- Great King Norodom Sihanouk sent a large basket of flowers to the DPRK embassy in Phnom Penh in congratulation of the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
 Written on the ribbon of the basket were letters reading "Glory to His Excellency Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people. Great King Norodom Sihanouk and Great Queen Norodom Monineath of Cambodia."    
 Upon the authorization of the great king, Kong Sam Ol, deputy prime minister in charge of the Royal Palace and minister of the Royal Palace, together with the secretary and the under-secretary of state for the Ministry of the Royal Palace, paid a congratulatory visit to the DPRK embassy on Feb. 16 and laid the floral basket before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and paid respects to them.

articles.title: Large Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy from Cambodian King
articles.content:
Large Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy from Cambodian King 
    Pyongyang, February 19 (KCNA) -- Cambodian King Norodom Sihamoni sent a large floral basket to the DPRK embassy in Phnom Penh in congratulation of the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
 Written on the ribbon of the basket were letters reading "Glory to His Excellency Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people. Cambodian King Norodom Sihamoni."
 Upon the authorization of the king, Kong Sam Ol, deputy prime minister in charge of the Royal Palace and minister of the Royal Palace, paid a congratulatory visit to the DPRK embassy on Feb. 16, together with the secretary and the under-secretary of state for the Ministry of the Royal Palace, and laid the floral basket before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and paid respects to them.
 The deputy prime minister said on the occasion: The king wished 
Kim Jong Il greeting his birthday good health and greater success in his noble work to lead the Korean nation and people to prosperity and development. The king expressed the expectation that the traditional ties of friendship between the two countries will be everlasting.

Kim Jong Il Praised by Egyptian Public Figure
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Egyptian Public Figure 
    Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- The DPRK is sure to win as there are the headquarters headed by leader Kim Jong Il who has defended truth, principles and the banner of socialism and the people rallied around him, said the chairman of the Misr Arab Socialist Party of Egypt, in a statement issued on Feb. 11 on the occasion of the February holiday.
 He said that Kim Jong Il has successfully carried forward the idea and cause of President Kim Il Sung and pursued the unique Songun policy. 
 Kim Jong Il has strengthened the army and encouraged all the people to learn from the fighting spirit of the servicepersons and bolstered the military capability in every way despite the U.S. vicious moves to stifle socialist Korea, he noted, and continued:
 Under his wise guidance the DPRK has acquired nuclear deterrent, while shattering the U.S. moves to isolate and stifle it and firmly standing against dominationism.

General Secretary of WPB Leaves Here
articles.content:
General Secretary of WPB Leaves Here
    Pyongyang, February 18 (KCNA) -- Baudouin Deckers, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Belgium, left here for home today after winding up his eight-day visit to the DPRK.
 He was seen off at the airport by Kim Thae Jong, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.    
 During his stay he inspected the venue of the 10th Kimjongilia Festival, the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, the University of National Economics and other places.
